import React, { Component } from "react"; import './secondpage.css'; import Poster from './poster.js' import PosterSample from './postersamples.js' import exportedposters from './App.js' import doggo from './img/doggo.jpg'; // import {Rectangle, Circle, Ellipse, Line, Polyline, CornerBox, Triangle} from 'react-shapes'; const ii1 = require('./img/sample1.png') const ii2 = require('./img/sample2.png') const ii3 = require('./img/sample3.png') const ii4 = require('./img/sample4.png') const ii5 = require('./img/sample5.png') const ii6 = require('./img/sample6.png') const ii7 = require('./img/sample7.png') const ii8 = require('./img/sample8.png') const ii9 = require('./img/sample9.png') const ii10 = require('./img/sample10.png') // secondpage will read in the posters, the currently selected one needs to be // read by the poster component and passed to the parent\\ // listdata from child is the information gotten from the child class SecondPage extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.state = { parray: exportedposters, clickedposter: ii2, listDataFromChild: null } // this.handleSelection = this.handleSelection.bind(this) } componentDidMount() { console.log(this.props) console.log(this.state) } // parental callback to get access to what the child sent - clicked posters data myCallback = (dataFromChild) => { this.setState({ listDataFromChild: dataFromChild }); }; render() { return (

); } } export default SecondPage;
